00020 /**
00021  * @file   MsgStream.cpp
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Mon Jul 10 16:30:07 2006
00024  * 
00025  * @brief  File for handling messages and printing them to the stream.
00026  * 
00027  * 
00028  */
00029 
00030 //
00031 #include "util/MsgStream.h"
00032 //
00033 #include "util/Err.h"
00034 #include "util/Util.h"
00035 
00036 using namespace std;
00037 
00038 /** 
00039  * A message to be processed by the stream.
00040  * 
00041  * @param level - What level of verbosity is associated with this message, higher number == more verbosity.
00042  * @param msg - Message that is to be processed.
00043  * @param delimiter - Should a delimiter be emitted as well?
00044  */
00045 void MsgStream::message(int level, const std::string &msg, bool delimiter) {
00046   if(level <= m_Verbosity && m_Out != NULL) {
00047     if(!m_Out->good()) {
00048       Err::errAbort("MsgStream::message() - problem writing to stream.");
00049     }
00050     string msgMod = msg;
00051     Util::subChar(msgMod, '\t', ' ');
00052     (*m_Out) << msgMod;
00053     if(delimiter)
00054       (*m_Out) << std:: endl;
00055   }
00056 }
